intro: Aleuritia knuthiana, commonly known as the Chinese elderberry, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It features small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright red berries in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. The berries are edible and have been used in traditional Chinese medicine.
